alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 4:34PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Henry, northwestern Clay and Quitman Counties through 600 PM EDT/500 PM CDT/... At 534 PM EDT/434 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lumpkin to near Georgetown to near Louisville. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Garnersville, Coates, Wire Bridge, Bagby State Park, Bonapartes Retreat, Scottsboro Crossroads, Hatcher, Morris, Crossroads, Ricks Place and Moores Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
